intro: Parietaria micrantha var. coreana, commonly known as Korean wall-rocket, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its small, white flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has a low-growing habit and is often found in temperate regions of Korea and northeastern China. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
